name: Poliwag

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Poliwag but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd don't count.

flavorText: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming over trying to stand.

strengths: Water Gun can scale up to 30 damage with just 3 Water Energy total
Energy-efficient base attack requiring only 1 Water Energy
Evolves into Poliwhirl and eventually the powerful Poliwrath
Low retreat cost of 1 provides flexibility
weaknesses: Very low 40 HP makes it fragile and easy to knock out
Grass weakness is significant with popular Grass Pokemon in format
Damage scaling caps at 2 extra Water Energy, limiting maximum output
No resistance to help offset defensive vulnerabilities
Requires multiple Energy attachments to reach competitive damage
synergies: Energy Trans from Venusaur can move extra Water Energy to Poliwag for boosted damage
Rain Dance Blastoise allows rapid Energy attachment to maximize Water Gun
Defender can help Poliwag survive an extra turn to build up Energy
Professor Oak can help draw into additional Water Energy cards
counters: Bulbasaur - Grass weakness and Leech Seed create major problems
Tangela - Double weakness and status effects are devastating
Bellsprout - Grass typing and Call for Family make this difficult
